T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Da.title: DataStorage Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Da.desc: An element which allows an API applications to organize and store data.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Da.remarks: Applications can create instances of these elements to logically organize different sets of ExtensibleStorage entities into separate elements. This allows an application to update one set of data in a local workshared project without locking other elements.

   2. Contains only letters, digits, or any of the following special characters:
   ! " # & \ ( ) + , . - : ; < = > ? _ ` | ~

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.AcceptableName Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Checks whether a string is an acceptable name for a Schema or a Field.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: For interoperability, names are required to be usable as C++ identifiers. The allowable characters are ASCII letters, numbers (except the first character) and underscore. The length must be between 1 and 247 characters.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: Field Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc:
The description of a field within a Schema in the Extensible Storage framework. Contains
   the field's name, type, access control and documentation.

props.d:
Reports whether this is a simple field containing one value,
   or a container of multiple values.
The overall description of the Field.
The name of the field.
Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
The type of the keys stored in the field.
The Schema to which this Field belongs.
The Schema describing the subentity (or subentities) stored in this Field.
The GUID of the Schema describing the subentity (or subentities) stored in this Field.
The type of the values stored in the field.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Get<FieldType>(Field, ForgeTypeId) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Retrieves the value of the field in the entity.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The template parameter must match the type of the field (specified when creating the Schema) exactly; this method does not perform data type conversions. The types for containers are IList for arrays and IDictionary for maps.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Co.title: ContainerType Enumeration
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Co.desc: An enumerated type indicating if the field represents a single value or a container of multiple values.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Set<FieldType>(Field, FieldType, ForgeTypeId) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Stores the value of the field in the entity.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The template parameter must match the type of the field (specified when creating the Schema) exactly; this method does not perform data type conversions. The types for containers are IList for arrays and IDictionary for maps. This method only modifies your copy of the Entity. Store the Entity in an element or another Entity to save the new value. Write access check is not performed on each call to Set. Instead, write access is checked when you try to save the Entity in an Element or another Entity.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: Field.SubSchema Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc: The Schema describing the subentity (or subentities) stored in this Field.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity(Guid) Constructor
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Creates a new Entity corresponding to the Schema of the specified GUID.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: You can store the newly created Entity in an Element or in another Entity. If you do not have write access to the Schema, an exception will be thrown. If the GUID does not correspond to a known Schema, the Entity will be invalid and an exception will be thrown.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.Dispose Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Releases all resources used by the SchemaBuilder

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.IsValidObject Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: If the corresponding Revit native object is destroyed, or creation of the corresponding object is undone, a managed API object containing it is no longer valid. API methods cannot be called on invalidated wrapper objects.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: Field.Dispose Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc: Releases all resources used by the Field

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Set<FieldType>(String, FieldType) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Stores the value of the field in the entity.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The template parameter must match the type of the field (specified when creating the Schema) exactly; this method does not perform data type conversions. The types for containers are IList for arrays and IDictionary for maps. Note that when string values are specified as map keys, they are case-insensitive. This method only modifies your copy of the Entity. Store the Entity in an element or another Entity to save the new value. Write access check is not performed on each call to Set. Instead, write access is checked when you try to save the Entity in an Element or another Entity. This method is a shortcut that will look up the field by name. If you want to call it on many entities, it is faster if you look up the field yourself.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: Field.Schema Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc: The Schema to which this Field belongs.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Get<FieldType>(String) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Retrieves the value of the field in the entity.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The template parameter must match the type of the field (specified when creating the Schema) exactly; this method does not perform data type conversions. The types for containers are IList for arrays and IDictionary for maps. This method is a shortcut that will look up the field by name. If you want to call it on many entities, it is faster if you look up the field yourself.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Get<FieldType>(Field) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Retrieves the value of the field in the entity.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The template parameter must match the type of the field (specified when creating the Schema) exactly; this method does not perform data type conversions. The types for containers are IList for arrays and IDictionary for maps.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Clear(Field) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Resets the field to its default value.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The default value is zero for numeric fields, invalid value for identifiers and entities, and empty for strings and containers.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.Finish Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Registers and returns the created Schema object.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: While building schema during API application startup is allowed, it has some negative performance impact on file open and save. It is better for performance to defer schema creation till the moment it is about to be used.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: Schema.WriteAccessGranted Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Checks whether Entities of this Schema may be stored by the current add-in.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: Schema.ApplicationGUID Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc:
The GUID of the application or add-in that may access entities of this Schema under the
   Application access level.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.SetReadAccessLevel Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Sets top level read access (for entities)

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.ReadAccessGranted Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Checks whether this Entity may be retrieved by the current add-in.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: Schema.Dispose Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Releases all resources used by the Schema

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.SetVendorId Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc:
Sets the ID of the third-party vendor that may access entities of this Schema under the
   Vendor acess level, and to generally identify the owner of this Schema.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: This method throws an ArgumentException if the given vendor ID string is not valid. To understand the validity requirements for vendor ID strings, see the documentation for the ESSchemaBuilder method vendorIdIsValid(). Since vendor IDs are not case sensitive, the string will be converted to upper case before it is stored in the schema.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.RecognizedField Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Checks whether a Field belongs to the same Schema as this Entity.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: Schema.VendorId Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc:
The id of the third-party vendor that may access entities of this Schema under the
   Vendor access level.

props.d: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
The Schema describing this Entity.
The GUID of the Schema describing this Entity.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: Schema.SchemaName Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: The user-friendly name of the Schema.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.SetWriteAccessLevel Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Sets top level write access (for entities)

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.AddSimpleField Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Creates a field containing a single value in the Schema, with given name and type.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: The supported types are Boolean, Byte, Int16, Int32, Int64, Float, Double, ElementId, GUID, String, XYZ, UV and Entity.Note that data of type ElementId is not copied to new elements that are created via copy/paste or a linear or radial array.Note that a schema may contain a maximum of 256 fields.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Ac.title: AccessLevel Enumeration
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Ac.desc: Defines access levels to objects in the Extensible Storage framework.

Checks whether the given vendor ID string is valid. A valid vendor ID string:

   ! " # & \ ( ) + , . - : ; < = > ? _ ` | ~

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: Schema Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc:
The description of a single object (Entity) in the Extensible Storage framework. Contains
   identity information, documentation and the list of fields to be stored in the Entity.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: A Schema is similar to a class in most object-oriented languages, or to a C struct, while an Entity is an object of that class. The Schema object is immutable. To create and populate a Schema, use the SchemaBuilder class. Schemas are stored in the memory of the running instance of Revit and may be retrieved with the Lookup method. When a document containing Entities of a Schema is saved, the Schema is saved with the document too. Opening that document reintroduces the Schema into memory. As you plan to store your data in Revit, please be aware that the data will be stored in Revit elements. Overwhelming the Revit database will impact performance and stability, and will make the user unhappy. Also, remember that multiple add-ins may be storing their data simultaneously. Several kB per element or several MB per file are reasonable maximums for one add-in. If you have larger requirements, consider storing them in a separate database (such as SQLite) and storing keys into that database in Revit.

The framework will prevent subentities with incorrect schemas from being stored in the entity. Additionally, the access level of the subschema will be checked against the currently executing add-in and access to restricted subentities will be prevented.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc:
An object stored in the Extensible Storage framework. An Entity is described by a Schema,
   which serves both to identify an Entity, and to describe its contents (Fields).
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: An Entity is similar to an object in most object-oriented languages, while a Schema is the class of that object. The Get and Set methods are central - they provide access to the fields of the Entity. Note that an unitialized Entity retrieved from an Element or another Entity (if it has not been created yet) will be represented as an invalid entity, not . If an Element containing an Entity is split (e.g., a wall split), the Entity and its data will exist in both new Elements. If an Element containing an Entity is copied, the Element copy will also contain a copy of the Entity and its data. If an Entity stores an ElementId, and the Element with that ElementId is deleted, the stored ElementId will automatically be set to ElementId.InvalidElementId (-1).

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: FieldBuilder.SetDocumentation Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc: Sets the documentation string for the Field.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.remarks: While Entities may be hidden using access levels, Schemas and Fields are visible to clients and other developers. In the interest of clarity and interoperability, you are very strongly encouraged to provide good documentation with your Schemas. Explain the intent of the data and how it is meant to be interpreted. It is not useful to repeat information that can be observed directly (e.g. types and units). Note that documentation, like all other contents of Schemas and Fields is immutable once the add-in using the Schema is published.

If you want to call it on many entities, it is faster if you look up the field yourself.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: While Entities may be hidden using access levels, Schemas and Fields are visible to clients and other developers. In the interest of clarity and interoperability, you are very strongly encouraged to provide good documentation with your Schemas. Explain the intent of the data and how it is meant to be interpreted. It is not useful to repeat information that can be observed directly (e.g. types and units). Note that documentation, like all other contents of Schemas and Fields is immutable once the add-in using the Schema is published.

T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder Class
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: This class is used to create Schemas in the Extensible Storage framework.
T:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: Named parameter idiom: Methods that set up the Schema return a reference to the builder so you can invoke multiple methods in a chain (e.g., builder.setReadAccessLevel(...).setWriteAccessLevel(...)). Methods that add fields return a FieldBuilder instead.

props.d: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.

methods.d: Checks whether a string is an acceptable name for a Schema or a Field.

   of contained values.

   type of contained values.

   2. Contains only letters, digits, or any of the following special characters:
   ! " # & \ ( ) + , . - : ; < = > ? _ ` | ~

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Set<FieldType>(String, FieldType, ForgeTypeId) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Stores the value of the field in the entity.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The template parameter must match the type of the field (specified when creating the Schema) exactly; this method does not perform data type conversions. The types for containers are IList for arrays and IDictionary for maps. This method only modifies your copy of the Entity. Store the Entity in an element or another Entity to save the new value. Write access check is not performed on each call to Set. Instead, write access is checked when you try to save the Entity in an Element or another Entity. This method is a shortcut that will look up the field by name. If you want to call it on many entities, it is faster if you look up the field yourself.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.IsValidObject Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Specifies whether the .NET object represents a valid Revit entity.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: If the corresponding Revit native object is destroyed, or creation of the corresponding object is undone, a managed API object containing it is no longer valid. API methods cannot be called on invalidated wrapper objects.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.AddMapField Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc:
Creates a field containing an ordered key-value map in the Schema, with given name and
   type of contained values.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: The supported types for the keys are Boolean, Byte, Int16, Int32, Int64, ElementId, GUID and String. Floating-point types (Float, Double, XYZ and UV) are not supported because round-off errors frequently cause numeric instability. Subentities are not supported because they require a custom comparison operator. The suggested workarounds are either placing key values into an Array and using array indices for keys, or just using an Array of subentities. Natural comparison of contained types is used for sorting. The supported types for values are the same as for simple fields. See AddSimpleField(String, Type) for details. Note that a schema may contain a maximum of 256 fields.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: FieldBuilder(FieldBuilder) Constructor
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc: Constructs a new copy of the input ESFieldBuilder object.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity(Schema) Constructor
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Creates a new Entity corresponding to the Schema.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: You can store the newly created Entity in an Element or in another Entity. If you do not have write access to the Schema, an exception will be thrown.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: FieldBuilder.Ready Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc: Checks whether the builder may be used.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.remarks: All newly constructed FieldBuilders are usable until the call to the Finish method of the constructing SchemaBuilder.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.AddArrayField Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc:
Creates a field containing an array of values in the Schema, with given name and type
   of contained values.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: The supported types for the contents are the same as for simple fields. See AddSimpleField(String, Type) for details. Note that a schema may contain a maximum of 256 fields.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.title: SchemaBuilder.SetSchemaName Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.desc: Sets the name of the Schema.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Sc.remarks: The name is a user-friendly identifier of the Schema. GUIDs are used exclusively for Schema identity, but the name is useful to identify the Schema during development or in an error message. This field is required.

P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.title: Field.KeyType Property
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.desc: The type of the keys stored in the field.
P:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.Fi.remarks: For key-value maps, this is the key type. For all other field, this is NULL.

M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.title: Entity.Set<FieldType>(Field, FieldType) Method
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.desc: Stores the value of the field in the entity.
M:Autodesk.Revit.DB.ExtensibleStorage.En.remarks: The template parameter must match the type of the field (specified when creating the Schema) exactly; this method does not perform data type conversions. The types for containers are IList for arrays and IDictionary for maps. Note that when string values are specified as map keys, they are case-insensitive. This method only modifies your copy of the Entity. Store the Entity in an element or another Entity to save the new value. Write access check is not performed on each call to Set. Instead, write access is checked when you try to save the Entity in an Element or another Entity.
